data.title: Golisek Named Tournament MVP, Wolfpack wins 2024 US National Guts Frisbee Tournament
data.meta_description: MARQUETTE, Mich. -Â Sports Information Director, former NMU hockey player, and Marquette native Braden Golisek was crowned 2024 US National Guts Frisbee Champion
data.text:
Wolfpack defeats Slipped Disc en route to championship

MARQUETTE, Mich. - Sports Information Director, former NMU hockey player, and Marquette native Braden Golisek was crowned 2024 US National Guts Frisbee Champion and tournament MVP with Wolfpack, defeating Slipped Disc in the finals on Sunday, August 4.

The two day event was held August 3 and 4, 2024 at Tourist Park in Marquette, with 20 teams making up a field that celebrated 50 years of Guts Frisbee in Marquette. The Wolfpack team played a total of 15 games over two days, and was comprised of Golisek, Noah Gannon, Luke McCarthy, Tanner Beckman, Mike Houle, and brothers Cam and Justin Verigan.

Wolfpack and Slipped Disc first clashed in the winners bracket finals, where Wolfpack moved on to the championship after defeating Sliped Disc in three games. Slipped Disc then defeated UP Hardwood in the losers bracket finals to earn a rematch against Wolfpack in the championship, where Wolfpack would sweep Slipped Disc in two games en route to being crowned champions.

Golisek holding the Craig "Buck" Buchanan Memorial Trophy

Information from the tournament and live streams of both the grand finals and winners bracket finals from Sunday can be found on the USA Guts Frisbee Facebook page, here.

Along with being crowned champion and tournament MVP, Golisek will be team captain of USA 3 in the WFDF 2024 World Guts Championship (WGC). The WFDF 2024 World Ultimate Championships (WUC) will be held concurrently at the same venue in Gold Coast, Australia from Saturday the 31st of August through Saturday the 7th of September. The events will be staged at the Runaway Bay Sport Precinct, with satellite fields located at the Alabaster Drive Sports Precinct, and athlete accommodations will be adjacent to the beach at Surfers Paradise. WFDF expects more than 2,500 athletes from 40+ countries to participate in three Ultimate divisions (Open, Women's and Mixed) and in one of Guts Frisbee. Golisek's teammates Noah Gannon, Tanner Beckman, and Cam Verigan will also be competing and representing the United States in the 2024 WGC.

All things international frisbee can be found here.

About Guts Frisbee Originating in the Upper Peninsula of Michigan, The first International Frisbee Tournament was held in Eagle Harbor, Michigan, in 1958. There have been 47 teams awarded the Craig "Buck" Buchanan Memorial Trophy, with Wolfpack becoming the 48th to earn the honor.

Guts is one of the team events in the flying disc sports and is played by two teams of five players each with the official disc of the game is the Pro model frisbee disc. The playing field consists of two parallel goal-lines 15 m in length and 14 m apart. The teams stand in line opposite each other, each team defends a goal-line, and the disc is thrown back and forth between the teams. The object is to throw the disc through the line of defending players.

For more rules, watch the official video down below.
